title: Haldia (Vidhan Sabha constituency)
text:
Haldia (Vidhan Sabha constituency) () is an <a href="Vidhan%20Sabha">assembly</a> constituency in <a href="Purba%20Medinipur%20district">Purba Medinipur district</a> in the <a href="India">India</a>n <a href="States%20and%20territories%20of%20India">state</a> of <a href="West%20Bengal">West Bengal</a>. As a consequence of the orders of the Delimitation Commission, <a href="Sutahata%20%28Vidhan%20Sabha%20constituency%29">Sutahata (Vidhan Sabha constituency)</a> ceased to exist and Haldia (Vidhan Sabha constituency) came into existence in 2011. It is reserved for <a href="Scheduled%20castes%20and%20scheduled%20tribes">scheduled castes</a>.
Overview.
As per orders of the <a href="Delimitation%20Commission%20of%20India">Delimitation Commission</a>, No. 209 Haldia (Vidhan Sabha constituency) (SC) is composed of the following: <a href="Haldia">Haldia</a> municipality and <a href="Sutahata%20%28community%20development%20block%29">Sutahata</a> <a href="Community%20Development%20Block%20in%20India">community development block</a>.
Haldia (Vidhan Sabha constituency) is part of No. 30 <a href="Tamluk%20%28Lok%20Sabha%20constituency%29">Tamluk (Lok Sabha constituency)</a>.
